content: Gross revenue for the second quarter increased by 22% over the prior year to $102.6 million, while net revenue, net of subcontractors, materials and other direct costs, increased 11.9% to $52.9 million for the quarter. The lower gross profit margin was primarily due to the higher mix of construction management revenues, lower software revenues and higher ramp-up costs for new programs in the current year quarter. Adjusted EBITDA was $1.2 million for the quarter compared to $3.3 million a year ago, reflecting the change in the mix of revenues combined with higher costs versus revenue recognized related to the new California IOU programs. A lot of this year, the revenue youâll start seeing â for the first time, actually, youâll start seeing that revenue come in the third quarter of this year because, as Tom mentioned in his script, for the first time now at 18 months, weâre building projects out and completing them.
